titleStmt.title: J. J. Allnutt to James R. Page
CWG1993

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
LouisvilleNov 25th 1864
, Esq.James R. Page
Dr Sir

Being desirous of obtaining a Commission as N. Public, I take the liberty of addressing you. in a few lines in order that through you as, Ass't -- Sec. State. I may be able to obtain s'd commission, you will confer a lasting favor by attending to it immediately, Enclosed please find $1.00, for your services or fee.

I refer you to 's note below.Mr. Cochrell
Very Respct
J. J. Allnutt

I am personally acquainted with J J Allnutt and take pleasure in recommending as a suitable person to be commissioned Notary Public for , he is a young Lawyer in this city, yous truly R. H. CockrellJefferson County

Jefferson Co
Notary Public
J J Allnutt
apptd 26th Nov/64
